subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] DRV - Direct Radio Voice recordings
author: Misty Dawn
full_text:
Al

Yes definitely they are helping. They often will suggest settings for software or filters or methods to use to record or even times when they will be more active. I just dont always understand what they mean until it smacks me in the face later LOL I am not a technical type person so I find myself using google alot to look words/subjects up that make no sense to me. Even then I am just feeling my way around in the dark when it comes to the how or the why. I dont ask how or why anymore I just focus more on the "who/what". No matter the method I get the same group of talkers (+/- the strangers who pop in to say hello).

Misty


--- On Sun, 8/31/08, threadsintyme@... <Threadsintyme@...> wrote:

> From: threadsintyme@... <Threadsintyme@...>
> Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] DRV - Direct Radio Voice recordings
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Date: Sunday, August 31, 2008, 9:26 AM
> Hi Misty,
> Thank YOU for the simple, concise explanation. It appears
> that whoever or whatever is "controlling" the
> sessions on the other side, they seem to be helping organize
> the best method of recording by each individual who is
> recording. It almost seems as if there were some sort of
> organized effort to help, doesn't it? :) 
> Al
> 
> -- Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@...> wrote:
> 
> Al
> Franks box sweeps the band either linear or random and
> grabs snippets of stations and for me is much louder
> fragments of speech that I often hear live as I record. With
> this its just on no station, recording what sounds like
> nothing or the occasional buzz whoosh that comes thru. Frank
> will have to be the one to explain the difference in detail
> he knows alot more about the subject when it comes to how
> his box functions.
> 
> I know some have had loud conversations using DRV I think
> theres even a youtube video of someone doing that. But I did
> not hear them like a broadcast the way they did, I didnt
> hear them at all until I played it back and was surprised to
> hear our names and speaking directly to me or my friend. Its
> interesting. It would be nice to get to that level of
> clarity that some claim to have had. I do believe the
> possibility exists to expand in many areas and this will
> just be one more I will be adding to my agenda.
> 
> Misty
> 
> --- On Sat, 8/30/08, threadsintyme@...
> <Threadsintyme@...> wrote:
> 
> > From: threadsintyme@...
> <Threadsintyme@...>
> > Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] DRV - Direct Radio Voice
> recordings
> > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> > Date: Saturday, August 30, 2008, 9:46 PM
> > I was wondering what the difference between the DRV
> sessions
> > and a recording made through the "Frank's
> > Box", or any other box might be? 
> > Thank YOU!
> > Al
> > 
> > -- "Misty" <bulletbabea@...>
> wrote:
> > 
> > I did a DRV session last night and I just wanted to
> share
> > some of the 
> > results with the group. They came thru quite clearly
> even
> > tho they had 
> > some difficulty making the link to where I was tuned
> off
> > station in 
> > the "dead" zone. I usually start and end my
> sweep
> > sessions off station 
> > but they had been coming thru quite clear there so
> last
> > night I did the 
> > entire session that way. As always Tony was there to
> lend a
> > hand.
> > 
> > http://www.esnips.com/web/directradiovoice
> > 
> > For those who have any difficulty playing the files
> try
> > downloading 
> > then playing.
> > 
> > Misty
> >
